Articles.Content:
So I am trying to just build a simple unmanned probe to orbit. Every time I go to the launch pad, I immediately get an error message that says "Vessel lost control due to PartsModule/Command/ControlStatus/NoCommnetConnection"

My stack is RA-2 Antenna > HECS > OX-STAT panels (x6) > Z-200 battery > Decoupler > Booster.

Hmm. Its possible I might have found a way past the issue. I do get the error while on the Launch Pad, but if I then go into the HECS module in the Parts Manager, and disable and re-enable it, the module status goes from "No Commnet Connection" to "Disabled", to All Good (dont remember the exact status name). So I think this is just a bug. Maybe this discussion belongs in the bugs section

There is also a bug where if you perform a stage separation to release something with a probe core, that new vessel will not have comms even though it's got EC, a probe core, and an antenna. One workaround in this case is to do a quicksave/quickload (F5/F9) and then all appears to be well. This may be analogous to the problem/solution you've found.
